tool_description: The easiest way to Manage your Marketing Links
name: ClickMeter
title: ClickMeter

api_list.name: Get datapoint by id
api_list.description: Datapoint details

api_list.name: Click Stream
api_list.description: Return the clickstream for the desired object.

optional_parameters.name: group
optional_parameters.description: Id of the group. Mutually exclusive with datapoint.

optional_parameters.name: datapoint
optional_parameters.description: Id of the datapoint. Mutually exclusive with group.

optional_parameters.name: withConversion
optional_parameters.description: Add conversion data to clickstream.

optional_parameters.name: fields
optional_parameters.description: Fields to retrieve for the clickstream. Comma separated values.

api_list.name: Hit List
api_list.description: A detailed hits list for the last 90 days maximum

optional_parameters.name: fromDay
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

optional_parameters.name: toDay
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Row key from which to start retrieve objects. Use the lastKey in object response.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Maximum elements to retrieve. Defaults to 20 if not specified.

optional_parameters.name: fields
optional_parameters.description: Fields to retrieve for the hit list. Comma separated values.

api_list.name: Domain Count
api_list.description: Get a count of domains available

optional_parameters.name: name
optional_parameters.description: A pattern name expression. Example: twit*

optional_parameters.name: type
optional_parameters.description: A pattern expression for type. It can be "system", "dedicated", "go", "personal". Default: system. Example: system

api_list.name: Get Tag
api_list.description: Get the specified tag.

api_list.name: Groups count
api_list.description: Groups count

optional_parameters.name: status
optional_parameters.description: Filter by group status. It can be "active", "deleted", "all". Default is "all"

optional_parameters.name: tags
optional_parameters.description: A comma separated list oftags you want to filter with.

optional_parameters.name: createdafter
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

optional_parameters.name: createdbefore
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

api_list.name: Account Deail
api_list.description: Get details of the current logged account.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ideas2it-ClickMeter-v1.p.rapidapi.com/account"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ideas2it-ClickMeter-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

print(response.json())

        }

api_list.name: Datapoint Hit List
api_list.description: A detailed hits list for the last 90 days maximum by DataPoint

optional_parameters.name: fromDay
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

optional_parameters.name: toDay
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Row key from which to start retrieve objects. Use the last Key in object response.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Maximum elements to retrieve. Defaults to 20 if not specified.

optional_parameters.name: fields
optional_parameters.description: Fields to retrieve for the hit list. Comma separated values.

api_list.name: Get a full list of datapoints with statistics
api_list.description: Get a full list of datapoints with statistics, based on filters

required_parameters.name: timeframe
required_parameters.description: Timeframe can be "today", "yesterday", "last7", "last30", "last90", "beginning", "custom". If "custom" use also fromDay-toDay parameters.

optional_parameters.name: toDay
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

optional_parameters.name: status
optional_parameters.description: By default "all": a filter by entity status (deleted, paused, spam, active).

optional_parameters.name: tag
optional_parameters.description: Name of tag to filter with.

optional_parameters.name: favourite
optional_parameters.description: Filter by favourites only.

optional_parameters.name: sortBy
optional_parameters.description: Sort list by specified field (totalclicks, totalviews, uniqueclicks, uniqueviews, conversionsvalue, convertedclicks, spiderhitscount, entityData.datapointname, entityData.creationdate).

optional_parameters.name: sortDirection
optional_parameters.description: Direction to sort with: "asc" or "desc".

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Maximum elements to retrieve. Default is 20.

optional_parameters.name: fromday
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Where to start when retrieving data. 0 if it's not specified.

api_list.name: Datapoints count
api_list.description: Datapoints count

optional_parameters.name: type
optional_parameters.description: The type of datapoint to retrieve. Possible types: TL, TP, TD.

optional_parameters.name: tags
optional_parameters.description: A comma separated list of tags you want to filter with.

optional_parameters.name: createdafter
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

optional_parameters.name: createdbefore
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

optional_parameters.name: status
optional_parameters.description: Filter by datapoint status. It can be "active", "deleted", "spam", "paused", "all". Default is "all".

api_list.name: Conversions count
api_list.description: Conversions count

optional_parameters.name: status
optional_parameters.description: Filter by group status. It can be "active", "deleted", "all". Default is "all"

optional_parameters.name: createdafter
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

optional_parameters.name: createdbefore
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

optional_parameters.name: textsearch
optional_parameters.description: A pattern name expression. Example: "twit" will match with all the conversion names starting with "twit"

api_list.name: Plan Detail
api_list.description: Get detail of the plan used by this account. Valid only for MASTER key.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ideas2it-ClickMeter-v1.p.rapidapi.com/account/plan"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ideas2it-ClickMeter-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Datapoint health statuses Count
api_list.description: Datapoint health statuses Count

optional_parameters.name: httpcode
optional_parameters.description: Count only statuses with the given HTTP response code. It can be 2XX, 4XX, 5XX.

optional_parameters.name: isspam
optional_parameters.description: Count only statuses with the given isSpam value.

optional_parameters.name: latency
optional_parameters.description: Count only statuses with latency >= the given value.

api_list.name: Datapoint health status by id
api_list.description: Retrieve some informations about the status of the destination URL associated to a datapoint. Available info depends on the account plan

api_list.name: Get aggregated counts with daily breakdown
api_list.description: Get aggregated counts with daily breakdown

required_parameters.name: timeframe
required_parameters.description: Timeframe can be "today", "yesterday", "last7", "last30", "last90", "beginning", "custom". If "custom" use also fromDay-toDay parameters.

optional_parameters.name: fromDay
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

optional_parameters.name: toDay
optional_parameters.description: A date in the format YYYYMMDDHHmm.

optional_parameters.name: groupBy
optional_parameters.description: Can select the granularity of the list “day, week, month”. BEWARE in “beginning” timeframe you must set this to “month”.

api_list.name: List Domains
api_list.description: List domains to which is possible to register a datapoint

optional_parameters.name: name
optional_parameters.description: A pattern name expression. Example: twit*

optional_parameters.name: type
optional_parameters.description: A pattern expression for type. It can be "system", "dedicated", "go", "personal". Default: system. Example: system

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Where to start when retrieving domains. Zero if not specified.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Maximum elements to retrieve. 20 if not specified.

api_list.name: List of datapoint health statuses
api_list.description: Retrieve the list of the links which have some status information attached.

optional_parameters.name: httpcode
optional_parameters.description: Filter statuses by HTTP response code to a simple GET request. It can be 2XX, 4XX, 5XX.

optional_parameters.name: isspam
optional_parameters.description: If true, it returns only the datapoints with a blacklisted destination URL.

optional_parameters.name: latency
optional_parameters.description: Retrieve all the datapoint with latency (milliseconds) >= the specified value. Example: latency = 2500 , which means latency >= 2,5 seconds.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Maximum elements to retrieve. 20 if not specified.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Where to start when retrieving domains. Zero if not specified.

optional_parameters.name: createdbefore

required_parameters.name: timeframe
